allData.occupation: Basketball Coach, Director of Operations, Basketball Advisor | Extensive Background in NCAA Basketball Programs | Year-over-Year Success in Team Performance, Player Recruitment & Program Improvement

positions.title: Associate Head Basketball Coach
positions.description:
OVERVIEW:

Functioned as a primary Recruiting Coordinator, traveling all across the U.S. to evaluate and recruit talent for the Binghamton University’s basketball program. Organized events for each coach to attend and document specific prospects to evaluate. Provided written reports on prospects to all coaches. 

Organized customized workouts for players to capitalize on their strengths and work on improvements, with workouts emphasizing fundamentals of the game. Built trust with players, engaging in daily conversations about the game of basketball, their personal aspirations, and issues affecting their play. 

Arranged the playing schedule each year, including research of potential opponents, and organized all information within the calendar. Scouted opponents during the season, including numerous hours of analyzing and evaluating opponents.

HIGHLIGHTS:

☑ Coached 13 All-Conference selections and 2 Rookie of the Year award recipients, contributing to their achievements through customized workouts and one-on-one engagement.

☑ Played key part in setting program records for non-conference wins (9) in 2016-2017 and 2017-2018, bringing the program from last in the conference to the 6th seed in 2015 and 5th seed in 2016.

☑ Recruited numerous student-athletes to the program over an 8-year period, bringing in competitive individuals who valued a top-notch education and positively represented the program on and off the court.

☑ Organized and executed the first-ever basketball alumni weekends, bringing back several players from the 80s, 90s, and 2000s, achieving positive attendance in most years.

☑ Recruited players with high character and academic backgrounds (bringing in 10 newcomers), as well as ensuring 100% compliance with NCAA rules and regulations. Graduated 25 players and stabilized the Academic Progress Report that improved from 913 (under practice reduction penalty) to 973 in 2013-2014 and 990 in 2017-2018 (all above 930 avoid sanctions).

positions.title: Associate Head Basketball Coach
positions.description:
OVERVIEW:

Brought on board to help transition the program into Division I Basketball and an NCAA Conference. Assisted in fundraising efforts to maintain and increase the overall basketball budget. Recruited and coached student-athletes, serving as a positive role model and helping them develop athletically, academically, and emotionally. 

Contributed to upgrading the program facilities via fundraising and community support. Managed detailed expense reports and the travel budget.

HIGHLIGHTS:

☑ Played a key role in achieving the first winning record for the team in CSUB’s Division I history, and their first-ever postseason invite to the CIT in 2011-2012, through talent recruitment, player development scouting, and in-game coaching.

☑ Organized and arranged all aspects of team travel for a group of 15 players and 6 staff members. Engaged in extensive nationwide travel due to the team’s non-conference status, including trips to Oregon, Texas, New Jersey, Nebraska, Idaho, and Utah. Booked flights, buses, and hotels, organized meals, and handled various travel issues (e.g., cancelled flights, bus issues) – all on a limited budget.

☑ Developed and cultivated community relationships that benefitted the program. Organized and created an exclusive Basketball Donors Club /Roadrunner Tip-In Club to generate financial support for the program. Organized a golf outing as well as an exclusive dinner for a select group of donors, raising over $10K.

positions.title: Assistant Basketball Coach / Director Of Operations
positions.description:
As Director of Operations, managed all administrative areas of the program, including alumni, fundraising, preseason and postseason banquets, and community outreach initiatives. Managed a $5M annual budget. Served as a liaison with Marketing, the Ticket Office, Compliance, and Sports Information areas. Coordinated official and unofficial visits to campus. Planned and served as the Director for all summer camps.

As Assistant Coach, interacted with players on academic and social progress, acted as a liaison with multiple departments and groups, and built community relationships. My main role encompassed recruiting, scouting, and player skill development.

HIGHLIGHTS:

☑ Spearheaded efforts in the team reaching the NCCA Round of 32 in 2008 and NCAA 8 Elite in 2009, representing a turnaround from previous issues (improved APR from 897 in 2005-2006 to 960 in 2011-2012). Also, during our time there we had 4 NBA draft picks including the 1st overall pick Blake Griffin in 2009. He was the consensus national player of the year.

☑ Transformed and improved the summer camps, with the team camp growing from ~50 teams to close to 100 teams in a single year. Reduced costs by changing 2-week camps into day camps ($25K savings).

☑ Created and organized the first-ever OU Fantasy Camp, as well as coordinating the Elementary Reading Program (with players visiting local elementary schools).

☑ Established the first committee with different departments to change ticket prices and assist in influencing attendance. (e.g., created a basketball-specific student fan group)

allData.headline: Basketball Coach, Director of Operations, Basketball Advisor | Extensive Background in NCAA Basketball Programs | Year-over-Year Success in Team Performance, Player Recruitment & Program Improvement
allData.summary:
OVERVIEW:

With over 20 years of experience in basketball, includes Director of Operations and Associate Head Basketball Coach positions, I am a basketball lifer who is deeply passionate about growing and improving basketball programs. Throughout my career, I have built a record of success in multiple areas, include leading teams to NCAA Tournament appearances, recruiting top-talent U.S. and global athletes, and transforming under-performing programs into winning programs.

Leveraging significant experience in basketball operations and youth engagement, I have contributed to the development and growth of multiple successful basketball programs at the collegiate level. On a player level, I create customized strategies to help optimize their academic and athletic performance, including tailored workouts and academic advisement. From a program standpoint, I ensure full compliance with NCAA regulations and build exceptional alumni/community relationships to gain support (including financial) for program goals. 

I am particularly interested in the growth and expansion of the game of basketball on an international scale. My experience in this area is the recruitment of student-athletes from around the globe. I am a strong advocate and support of expanding the game of basketball to all areas of the world, and my future career endeavors will include this as a personal and professional goal.

At all time, I ensure high standards of excellence in teaching the game of basketball and life skills. To that end, I have developed and executed basketball-related activities, camps, and events that earned highly positive feedback and enabled the continued success of basketball programs.

SELECTED HIGHLIGHTS & KEY CONTRIBUTIONS:

☑ Binghamton University: Setting program records for non-conference wins (9) in 2016-2017 and 2017-2018.

☑ Cal State Bakersfield University: Achieving the first winning record for the team in CSUB’s Division I history.

☑ University of Oklahoma: Reaching the NCCA Round of 32 in 2008 as well as the NCAA Elite Round in 2009.

☑ Bucknell University: Coaching all-time winningest program in Patriot League history, w/ 100% graduation rate.
